content.question: Which of the following data could best support the claim that species B arose from a speciation event in Lake <math alttext="one" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: All of the fish species occupy the same niches in their respective lakes.

<math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></math> analysis shows fewer differences between species A and species B in Lake <math alttext="one" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> than between species B and the populations in Lake <math alttext="two" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Species A and species B have similar body shapes due to convergent evolution in their habitats.

Individuals of species A from Lake <math alttext="one" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> can mate and produce viable offspring with individuals of species A from Lake <math alttext="two" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></math> analysis shows fewer differences between species A and species B in Lake <math alttext="one" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> than between species B and the populations in Lake <math alttext="two" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 2.B: Explain relationships between characteristics of biological models in both theoretical and applied contexts.
